question: Question_01_(b)
statement:
Determine whether the vector b =$\begin{pmatrix}1\\ 1\\ 1\end{pmatrix}$
is in the column space of the matrix A. above.
sols:
To determine if b is in the column space of A, we have to make sure that
b is a linear combination of the column space of A $A\vec{x} = b$

If there is a solution for $\vec{x}$, then we can write b as a linear
combination of the columns of A We can do this by row reduce the matrix
{[}A\textbar{}b{]} $\begin{bmatrix}
3& 0 & -2 & 1\\ 
1& -2& 3& 1\\ 
4& -2& 1& 1
\end{bmatrix}\xrightarrow[R2 = R1-3R2]{R3 = R3 - 4R2}\begin{bmatrix}
1& 0& \frac{-2}{3}& \frac{1}{3}\\ 
0& 6& -11& -2\\ 
0& 6& -11& -3
\end{bmatrix}\xrightarrow[R3 = R2 - R3]{R2 = R2/6}\begin{bmatrix}
1& 0 & \frac{-2}{3} & \frac{1}{3}\\ 
0& 1 & \frac{-11}{6} & \frac{-1}{3}\\ 
0& 0& 0 &1 
\end{bmatrix}$

The last row of the reduced row form shows that there is no solution for
this augmented matrix. Therefore, vector b$\begin{pmatrix}
1\\ 
1\\ 
1
\end{pmatrix}$ is not in the column space of matrix A = $\begin{pmatrix}
3 & 0& -2\\ 
1& -2& 3\\ 
4& -2 & 1
\end{pmatrix}$
